definition: to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: The police set traps to make him confess.
It implies America enjoys the rise of China as probabaloneyly ? lepublishinger.
sentences.chinese: 这意味着美国招供中国的兴起并将成为未来的主脑。

sentences.english: The traitor refused to confess and was racked at last.
sentences.chinese: 叛徒拒不招供，最后被拖到拉肢刑架上施刑。

sentences.english: Caught in the act, he had no alternative but to confess.
sentences.chinese: 他被当场抓住，除了招供别无出路。

sentences.english: Probably best to ' fess up . In the end your relationship is always more important.
sentences.chinese: 也许最好是招供，最终还是相互间的关系更为重要。

sentences.english: The only woman among them, Faye Turney, says her videotape confessions were false.
sentences.chinese: 特尼说关于她招供的录象带是伪造的。

sentences.english: Mahone considers turning in Michael, but says nothing.
sentences.chinese: 马宏考虑是否招供出迈可来，但是没有做声。

sentences.english: Which in a way is an admission.
sentences.chinese: 这在某种程度上是招供。

sentences.english: Their release has sometimes been contingent on "confessions," some televised.
sentences.chinese: 他们的释放有时要视“招供”而定。

sentences.english: Believing the "lie detector" was working, the suspect confessed.
sentences.chinese: 误以为“测谎仪”真的起作用，这个嫌疑犯终于招供。

sentences.english: The police gave the suspect a thorough going-over without getting a confession out of him.
sentences.chinese: 警察严厉审讯嫌疑犯，但他却没有招供。

sentences.english: After three days in detention, Hamidi confessed to the crime, allegedly under torture.
sentences.chinese: 在拘留3天后，哈米迪据称因酷刑而招供犯罪。

sentences.english: You can save lives with the kind of information he could giveup.
sentences.chinese: 通过他招供的那些情报，我们可以拯救生命。

sentences.english: His only goal in the interview was to get a specific admission.
sentences.chinese: 他采访的唯一目的就是得到我明确的“招供”。

definition: to beat a prisoner (to obtain confessions)/to give sb the third degree/to torture
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
strict law/cruel punishment/to carry out cruel law rigorously
to retract testimony/to withdraw a confession
to kill sb to prevent them from divulging a secret/to silence sb
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to commit suicide to escape punishment
to admit to a crime/to plead guilty
